instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-3209: What is 820-3209? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.U7000: What is U7000? U7000 refers to the ISL6258 or ISL6259 charging IC on Macbooks from 2008-2012.
definitions.U7201: What is U7201? U7201 is responsible for the 3.3v and 5v power rails on many devices..
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .
definitions.PM_SLP_S4_L: What is PM_SLP_S4_L? PM_SLP_S4_L is a signal that puts the system into an S4 suspend to disk sleep state when it is low(_L means signal is asserted when voltage is low).
definitions.PP3V42_G3H: What is PP3V42_G3H? PP3V42_G3H is a power rail present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state and is the first rail that should be generated in Macbooks that use it. .
definitions.PP5V_S5: What is PP5V_S5? This is a 5v power rail that is present when the machine is in an S5 soft off state..
definitions.PPVRTC_G3H: What is PPVRTC_G3H? PPVRTC_G3H is a 3.3v power rail for the RTC circuit present when the machine is in a G3H global system hardware off state. .
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS? This power rail is PPBUS_G3H after going through a current sense resistor that sits between PPBUS_G3H & the input of PPBUS_G3H to circuitry that provides power for the CPU..
definitions.PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS: What is PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS? This is PPBUS_G3H after passing through a current sense resistor that splits it off from the rest of PPBUS_G3H. The purpose of this is so that we can measure how much current is flowing to this part of the machine..
definitions.SMC_RESET: What is SMC_RESET? SMC_RESET is not a signal, it is an abbreviation for “SMC_RESET_L”, which is the signal someone is referring to when they type “SMC_RESET”  "SMC_RESET_L is a signal that resets the SMC when it is low(this is what the “_L” prefix means), and lets the SMC out of reset mode when it is high. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air no green light
threads.message:
HI! I have this macbook air there is no have green light.. i found some corruption on the resistors <RESISTOR>R7721</RESISTOR>, <RESISTOR>R7720</RESISTOR> and the cap <CAPACITOR>C7723</CAPACITOR>.. i replaced this 3 but i haven't green light. No water damage in any other side.. looking for power rails i see <SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> Is missing, and i replace the <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> Looking for a solution but i have nothing. so, how i can know when the <SIGNAL>PM_SLP_S4_L</SIGNAL> is Missing? how to measure this?  i do check the resistance at the <RESISTOR>R7251</RESISTOR> and <RESISTOR>R7252</RESISTOR> and i have 00.2 ohms.. but i dont know how to measure the enable signals.

My measures


<SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> : @ <RESISTOR>R5301</RESISTOR> 8.16v
<SIGNAL>PPVIN_SW_T29BST</SIGNAL>  :  @ <CAPACITOR>C3890</CAPACITOR> 0v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_COMPUTING_ISNS</SIGNAL> : @ <CAPACITOR>C7556</CAPACITOR> 8,16v
<SIGNAL>PPBUS_S5_HS_OTHER_ISNS</SIGNAL> : @ Pin 23 <CHIP>U7201</CHIP> 8,16v
<SIGNAL>PP3V42_G3H</SIGNAL> : @ Pin 12 <CHIP>U7000</CHIP> 3,40v
<SIGNAL>PPVRTC_G3H</SIGNAL> : @ Pin 1 <CHIP>U2700</CHIP> 3,40v
<SIGNAL>PP5V_S5</SIGNAL> : @ 0,00v
<SIGNAL>PP3V_S5</SIGNAL> : @ 0,01v

Plz, whats should i do?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-3209</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER> Macbook air no green light
threads.message: PPBUS is too low, SMC is not running. <SIGNAL>SMC_RESET</SIGNAL> high? If yes then probably crap under SMC or dead SMC.
